doc.name: callbacks

syntax.example: set the callbacks of player to messageList

doc.summary: Specifies messages to be sent during playback of a movie.

examples.example: set the callbacks of player "Mist" to myCallbacks
set the callbacks of player "Do It!" to "2500,soundNotes"

description.p: Use the callbacks property to send callback messages to a player at certain points in the movie. This synchronizes the messages with the playback.
The callbacks of a player is a list of callbacks, one per line. Each callback consists of an interval number, a comma, and a message name.
By default, the callbacks property of newly created players is set to empty.
When an interval number is reached during playback, LiveCode sends the corresponding message to the player.
The number of intervals per second is specified by the player's timeScale property. The total number of intervals is given in the player's duration property.
